Reviews.Title: “Disappointing start to our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NapaneeFamily5
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed one night at this hotel before boarding a Southern Caribbean cruise. I found the gentleman at the front desk at night, when we were checking-in to be very abrupt and seemed really bothered by any questions I had. I had booked this room months in advance and followed up with an email a few days before. I also phoned to confirm my reservation and the man who answered the phone seemed very grumpy. We asked to have a cot in our room for one fo our kids. (I was happy they were willing to accomodate us with that, as I did not want to get 2 rooms and split up my family) When we got up to the room, there was no cot and I had to go down to the desk and was given one (without proper bedding, ie. no pillow) to carry back to the room on my own to the 4th floor. The view out our window was of parking lots and buildings and was full of loud urban noises. The room was okay. The breakfast area by the front lobby was not bad, but the breakfast was very limited and picked over. Luckily the morning desk clerk seemed a little more friendly and told me about getting a bus to Old San Juan. Old San Juan was much more interesting and charming. It had a European flair. I would definitely recommend skipping a stay in San Juan, unless you like loud commercial noise, shopping, few trees, and little charm and go to Old San Juan instead.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: ckay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location 2 weeks ago for one night pre-cruise. The men that work at the front desk have attitude problems. At check-in, the employee spoke to us in a very unwelcoming manner and would not make eye contact with us. He was not busy at the time and we were respectful toward him. When I asked him for directions to restaurants, he said that he wouldn't answer "restaurant questions" until he was done checking us in. Then he gave us incomplete directions and we had to find our way in the dark with little help. There was a different desk clerk at check-out and he wasn't much nicer. We booked directly with the hotel so I don't understand the reason for this negative interaction. On the plus side, the lobby is cute and the breakfast room is very nice. It's located several blocks to the beach.The room was clean but the building has an institutional feeling. Not at all a holiday feeling. Post-cruise we stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan. It was about $50.00 more but much nicer. There is no comparison between the 2 hotels. The Sheraton exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated property, need TLC”
Reviews.Author: AllensWA
Reviews.Content: Really can't think of anything good to say. Location is ok, near all the other hotels and that's all. The main attractions are really in Old San Juan, it's probably better to stay there for a couple of days and then stay outside of San Juan, e.g. Luquillo or Fajardo for the islands, bio-bay, snorkel etc. Yes there is a bus stop that take you to Old San Juan for 75 cents but you never know when the buses are running. The first time we waited for 30 min and a taxi van offered to take all 4 of us at the stop for $2 each so we did. The second time, no such luck, we waited for 55 minutes and finally got on to a bus. I understand it is a budget hotel ($130!) but everything is really old. It shows that no one cares about the place nor have the customers in mind at all. The bathroom has a little sink, no counter space at all, no towel racks, not even a hook behind the door. The water in the shower is weak and cold. Wifi worked in our room for one day only, the rest of the time we had to sit in the lobby to get any signal. We were on the 4th floor with a lagoon "view" through a tiny little window and other buildings, at least we got some light, can't imagine what other rooms faces the other side would look like. Very depressing little place, we finally shorten our stay and moved to Luquillo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little spot just off the main drag in Condado”
Reviews.Author: BIP_TK
Reviews.Content: When we booked, this was the last room in Condado on Expedia. We're weren't expecting much, and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are spartan but roomy, the bathroom was fine (good water pressure) and the front desk folks were always friendly and helpful with parking (they have free onsite parking, but its crowded sometimes). Its only a short block from the beach, and in the middle of a good area. We also walked around the lagoon to rent SUP boards and had a great day there. This place is worth the money, just don't expect a 5**** hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient Condado hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms_scotsgirl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after a bad hotel experience in Old San Juan, and we were worried about its inconvenience to the city, but we turned out to be very happy with both location and the hotel itself. This hotel describes itself as 'European' which, as a European, I have to say hotels really ought to stop using as a euphemism for 'a bit small and run down' - there is nothing particularly 'European' about the hotel. It is situated on a quiet street just off Ashford Avenue (the main drag) and a 5 minute walk to the Lagoon and a 3 minute walk to the beach and plenty of restaurants and bars. And 1 minute from a Banco Popular ATM. Great location. We were initially given a room with a lovely view of the Lagoon (suggest you ask for this!) but with twin beds despite us specifying we wanted a double on booking.com; they turned out to have no doubles but instead gave us a room with two doubles at the same cost. Unfortunately this was on the other side of the hotel and had a grim view of the neighbouring building's wall. But it still had good light and was okay. The rooms are fine - a little dated but neat, clean, spacious enough, and with comfortable beds, as well as a little seating area with a table, wardrobe, drawers, a fridge, and suchlike. The breakfast is free and uninspiring, but fine - cereal, juice, and some pastries in a little breakfast room next to the reception. As well as enjoying the local restaurants and bars in Condado (a pleasant area with a beachy feel) paddleboarding on the Lagoon, and splashing on the beach, we walked to Santurce, which feels much less touristy and had great art museums, to Miramar, where we went to the cinema, and we caught a 15 minute bus to Old San Juan. Condado is also nearer to the airport, El Yunque, and Fajardo compared to Old San Juan, so it was nice to cut down the duration of the taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, friendly staff, comfy rooms at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Ford-Fifty-Six
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with comfortable clean rooms at a reasonable rate. The beach is just a short walk (3 minutes away) and easily accessible. The staff was exceptionally friendly, helpful, and knowledgable. The front desk clerk saved us considerable money suggesting we take the city bus to Old San Juan (75 cents per person) instead of calling a taxi. The rooms are spacious, quiet, and clean. The best part about our room was the air conditioning unit with a numbered temperature control where we could set the temperature at 74 degrees, just as we like. (Much more accurate than low, med, or high.) We've stayed at this hotel before and will again. It's the only place to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Boredsoxgirl23
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Great location, friendly staff and comfortable room. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive!!!! the staff made the difference, will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: Ramon V
Reviews.Content: It was recommended by some People that we met at the Condado wild eating at a restaurant nearby. The price and the location is just great, the staff was great and help full. Very clean and a lots of towels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Redbecca_46
Reviews.Content: Don't let the heat in the lobby discourage you: Your room will be cool, clean, and comfortable. This hotel was apparently built before central air conditioning, as the entrance and lobby window have no doors and glass (a secure curtain covers them, apparently, during storms or when traffic is not anticipated.) This hotel is in a perfect location 2 blocks from Condado Beach, a very safe and secure area. Though not fancy, our group of 24 was comfortably and affordably housed here for two nights at the start of our Puerto Rican tour. Plenty of dining options in the area, and the bus to Old San Juan is two blocks away. Continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel for the budget minded in a great locale”
Reviews.Author: Fosforita
Reviews.Content: The El Canario by the Lagoon was clean, grounds well kept, comfortable rooms, and the staff were really pleasant and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was adequate if small on selection, but everything was fresh. This hotel has an elevator, WiFi and good airconditioning. We stayed at the very top which had a wonderful rooftop garden. The hotel is close to everything with major casinos within easy walking distance. You really won't find a better deal in this great location.

Reviews.Title: “rooms basic but comfortable and in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Tyro2
Reviews.Content: location is great if you can't afford a beach hotel. bed was comfortable with air con working well. management are flexible as I received a late check out on request. the lagoon facing rooms are a bit dark inside and the room lack power points (none in bathroom) good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I completely enjoyed my week at this hotel and recommend it to everyone.”
Reviews.Author: richardluvtravelling
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Puerto Rico could not have been any better staying anywhere else but with the El Canario group. The staff is courteous and friendly, always smiling and cheerful. The desk attendants were wonderful, focused and dedicated to all guests having the best time available for as long as anyone wishes to stay with them ( Rafael, you are the best!) Manager Senor Pagan isequally ready to show all the guests the finest hospitality that he can offer. I will recommend this group to anyone wishing an intimate and pleasant environment in the Condado District. I would be happy to vacation here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, personable, and economical”
Reviews.Author: Colleen45
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find this rather small hotel amongst all the big expensive luxurious hotels. We were able to park, without extra charge. The desk managers were very helpful. The breakfast was like being in an European Hotel. Other tourists were friendly and delightful. Biggest problem was the noise of the airconditioner. We enjoyed the balconies, views, and establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value”
Reviews.Author: BoilerJulie
Reviews.Content: Nice location, just off the main area in Candado (close to key attractions). Friendly staff. Clean room. A little noisy if by the elevator. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: QuietCorner
Reviews.Content: El Canario was a fine stay. Te beds were comfortable and the bedding was clean. The bath was clean and the shower worked fine. The floor could have used a good cleaning but it didn't get in the way of things. The room was quiet and the Continental breakfast was adequate. We had no complaints with the staff. convenient location to the bus line to get to Old San Juan. Nice bars and beaches nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Little Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sweetdarby
Reviews.Content: Smaller hotel off the beaten bath. Just one block from the beach, casinos, restaurants etc. Great staff - Tito's always smiling. Room 407 had the best Lagoon view and came with a frige. Rooms are also a nice size. They also offer free parking in one of two drive ways on either side of the hotel. Condado area is just out side of Old San Juan about 15 minutes by bus and 20 mins from Isle Verde via bus. Great fresh fruit, cereal, pasties with the BEST coffee each morning. Microwaves and a washer dry at your disposal. Extra tidbit about 1 and half blocks away is the best Pizza at Mike's!

Reviews.Title: “Could had been better.”
Reviews.Author: michtraveller1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lagoon and was disappointed. For one , they never left enough towels and when we asked , the desk clerk would say that we had to wait till the morning because they are all locked up. So we had to buy towels and cloths. Then we saw roaches in our room and bathroom. We were trying to get another hotel but was unsuccessful at that time. The parking was in a small alley and you have to leave the key at the front desk, " Free Parking". Not enough adequate outlets In all, they did had hot water and and the maid service had clean our room good and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comy, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: viajero5
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay on our last night in Puerto Rico and this hotel worked out just fine. It is an older hotel and, as such, appears dated. It is not particularly stylish nor well decorated. But, it did have very clean rooms and common areas. We had two double beds, breakfast (and free parking) for something like $83.00 including taxes, which, I think would be difficult to find elsewhere. Pagan, the gentleman working when we checked in, was delightful. He kept us laughing, gave us information,etc. He even let us print our boarding passes for our flight the following day. The morning we checked out, he was wiping down the leaves of the plants in the lobby with a wet cloth. We were impressed with this attention to detail and cleanliness. I'd stay here again if I needed a place in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travelpsychedoc
Reviews.Content: Two of the 3 desk managers were beyond rude. Someone left food garbage in front of our room and the man on duty said it wasn't his job to pick it up - to wait until the housekeeping staff came back in the morning. One was barely civil when we asked for a restaurant recommendation on our first night. When a lud siren went off near our room he told us we could call the tourist police but made no effort to help or get us their phone number. this place was highly over-rated by TA.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. No More, NoLess”
Reviews.Author: Texastential
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a layover on the way to Dominica and back. As the previous reviewer said, it was okay for one night. The hotel itself is slightly run down, but clean with fairly large rooms. A room safe is provided, but you have to ask for a lock. I suggest you do so and lock up cameras, cash, etc. when leaving the room. They somehow had me as staying for four nights rather than one and authorized those charges on my CC. I nearly panicked when I saw that, but to his credit, Rafael explained it to me on the phone and all charges dropped off (other than the one night). You are about 15 mins. from the airport here. The ride costs $15 plus $1 per bag. Just around the corner is Ashford Ave. with everything from Walgreen's to Starbucks. I suggest dining at Cafe del Angel. Try the Mofongo! I would stay here again, just for a place to sleep in San Juan. Lodging is expensive there and El Canario cost at least $100 less than the other nearby options. All things considered, it really is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “El Canario by the Lagoon ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: ttiottn1
Reviews.Content: A friend and I needed a place to stay on our last night in Puerto Rico, 2/13, because the condo we rented for the previous days was already booked for that night. Based on cost and reviews here, we chose this place. It was ok for one night. We got a room with two twin beds. The room was very small but it did have a mini fridge. The bathroom was also small with a window without a screen instead of a fan to get rid of moisture; not ideal. But there was hot water when we needed it and the water pressure was adequate. We were on the 4th floor and had a balcony which faced the neighborhood; not scenic at all but nice to just sit outside and enjoy the wonderful weather. The room was clean but the phone and alarm clock did not work. Luckily my friend had a cell phone with an alarm. It also does not have a hair dryer and the hotel does not have any on site either. The location is good for tourists because itâ€™s near other larger hotels and resorts thus lots of places to walk to for food, beverage and shopping. The continental breakfast was fresh fruit, cold cereal, pastries, juice, milk and coffee (no coffee maker in the room). So if you just need a clean, cheap place to lay your head for one night, this will fit the bill. But I cannot recommend it for a longer stay. And next time Iâ€™d consider paying more to give another place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed - and more :)”
Reviews.Author: brooklinetownie
Reviews.Content: clean and comfy - near so much and friendly and helpful staff made visiting El Yunque and Old San Juan simple and joyful. I'll tell any friends who ask that this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “It is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: jack4u16
Reviews.Content: El Canario is the best place ever! The rates are very affordable, the rooms are perfect, the staff is very helpful and really care about your well being and safety! The rooms are very clean, and has all accomodations for a very reasonable price. The beach is only two minutes away, but yet there is privacy. I really loved my stay there and will defenitiely be there soon.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute hotel, poor choice”
Reviews.Author: Ange_from_cheshire
Reviews.Content: Old-style rooms, not very clean. Our room had an unpleasant odour. Little else to say apart from the location isn't bad for Condado. We have stayed in 4 hotels in San Juan and feel this should be an 80-90 dollar room in high season whereas they charged us 120 US dollars plus tax (which we ended up paying as we needed a room and availability elsewhere was very limited). Would not choose to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Miss this place and Rafael”
Reviews.Author: MeSarahLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 years in a row prior to boarding a cruise ship. Rafi is still there and we have kept in touch. I really enjoyed both stays here. walking distance to anything you would need including a great beach. They have a free breakfast that will fill you up, there is a washer and dryer on the 1st floor (bring your own soap and coins) There is a Walgreens a few blocks away. If you 'guys' need a hair cut, that is 1 block away - Rafi will point the direction. My son (who is with Rafi and I in one of the pics) got a nice hair cut there. The rooms that we slept in were clean and very comfortable and this from a girl that can feel lint in her shoe and must get it out NOW. No trouble with losing anything. Both times Rafael watched our luggage in the lobby (2nd time he put mine behind him) after check-out so we could go to the beach and shop before getting underway. Rafael knows where everything is and how to get there and what time the last bus leaves the mall. Some of you peeps will stay here and think it is an outdated hotel and you are looking for flare - no this is a very nice and homey place. You do not need a pool when the beach come on ocean - is just down the street. Rent a car for a day drive if you need to, but take it back at the end of the day. The bus is sooo cheap and takes you to just about anywhere you would want to go. I want very much to get back to Puerto Rico and see my friends especially Rafi, hope that my boyfriend will want to go with me next time I am able to go, we will stay here and go to all the places that I have been and to the places that I missed - the Rain Forrest will be one of them. And if Edward is still doing hair at Manicurissima in the Plaza Des Americas, maybe I will get a third hair cut by him. And if I can find my favorite bar tender Robert who at one time worked at Cafe Del Angel on Ashford in Condado, I will ask him to make that great "Love" drink called the Yellow Palm for Andy and I. Wonder if that restaurant is still there? Yes the elevator is tiny and slow, but you are in the Caribbean, you can pack light and carry your luggage up a couple flights and back down when you leave. What we did was put our bags in the elevator and took them out after walking down the stairs. I LOVE the El Canario by the Lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: spice_isle
Reviews.Content: We had a nice surprise after reading all the bad reviews on TripAdvisor about this hotel. We reached early (8.00AM) and they gave us an early check in - the staff were very friendly and accommodating. We also got a late (4.00 PM) checkout when we asked, because of our flight times. Our room was basic, but clean and well maintained (room 407), with a view overlooking the lagoon. WIFI was available and fast. The breakfast room offered pastries, fruit, toast, coffee / tea, juice and cereal, and was complimentary. Room was always cleaned and there were fresh towels every time. The hotel itself is just a few steps away from the main thoroughfare where there are restaurants, banks and stores. One of the parks in the area is less than 5 minutes slow walk away, and the beach is just a few steps past that. We would highly recommend it for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: moreno_vasquez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Canario by the Lagoon for 2 nights. I was charged twice for the same room, and also was charged an extra $109- without explanation. That brought the cost for my stay $300 more than what was on the receipt I was given. When I called to resolve this issue, the motel had only charged me an extra $109. They said they would refund this to my account. By the next day, they had charged me for the room twice, and, according to my bank, had made no attempt at refunding anything to my account. The employees at the Canario were rude to me and stopped taking my calls regarding the matter. It appears that they do not care about their customers once they have their customers' credit card numbers. Never stay at any of the Canario hotels. On another note, the Canario by the Lagoon boasts that every room has a view of either the lagoon or the ocean. This is misleading at best, and possibly an outright lie. I stayed in room 405 and had to lean over the edge of the safety rails on the room's "balcony" to see a tiny sliver of the lagoon. To recap: never stay at the Canario by the Lagoon unless you don't mind spending the money for a three star hotel and staying at a motel, and unless you like being treated rudely by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: yuanchueh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the really nice touristy part of town. The biggest problem is the staff. They were somewhat rude, and unhelpful. They offered poor advice for the city, and seemed more interested in playing games on their computer than helping their customers. We were advised of the nearest movie theater, and took a 40 minute bus ride to get there. On the way we passed 2 movie theaters...Go figure. The view in the room is of another building, and the rooms are cheap and unfurnished. I tried calling down to the front desk, but the phone didn't work. When we go back to Puerto Rico we will definately stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not save”
Reviews.Author: ISranang
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Is okay for sleeping purpose only. I stayed on May 31-June 1'08 in Room 104 . My Husband and I went meanly for shopping purpose. Thinking that the Hotel is save, we did some shopping and store them in our bag in the closet. We did not lock our bag becuase we thought is a alright save hotel. To our Surpise when we came back home we had some stuff missing. Some bedsheet, ninento DS and games we bought for our daughter and some blouses I purchase from the Mall. I think the Maid Rosa make her self home in our bags. We always meet her on our way out in the morning 8.00 Am in the area from our door and she asks us if we are coming back because she wants to start cleaning the room. My husband told her that we won't be back till tonight so she have the whole day. Well she really has the whole day to go thourgh our stuff. Bad expirence with my stolen stuff, so I don't think I will go their again , prefer staying in a name brand hotel were Maids know their place. Ann

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: kms1021
Reviews.Content: Basic room in good location if you like upscale shopping (Condado). Getting car in and out of narrow streets surrounding hotel is not for the faint-hearted. Also, your car is parked in a line of other cars alongside the hotel. To get it out, hotel clerk must move whatever cars are behind yours into the narrow street. No quick get-aways here, unless you happen to be the last car in the line.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: doyo22
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, management and staff were very friendly and I would love to stay there again when I return to Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Could use improvement”
Reviews.Author: stephanie60
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night in this small hotel in the Condado beach area of San Juan. Hotel is located near the Lagoon with some rooms having a partial view and just one block to beach. Lobby is tastefully furnished with tropical bamboo chairs and loveseat with a small breakfast room for complimentary morning rolls, coffee and juice. There is also a roof deck that could be very charming (but isn't) with a great view. Four suites are located on the roof deck. They advertise themselves as a "boutique hotel" but the problem is the rooms. They are dated and unattractive and pretty dark. We had room 306 with a view of the Lagoon from our balcony but there was nothing charming about it. At $126 a night (including all taxes) this is a fairly good deal for the area but with new bedspreads and curtains and a couple of scatter rugs this hotel would get more than just one night stands. Desk clerk on the Sunday we arrived was surly and uncooperative, but the person the next day was very helpful. Would recommend only if you don't care about the ambience of your hotel room. I would also check out El Canario by the Sea and El Canario Inn which are the same price but might have a bit more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away !”
Reviews.Author: happytr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night and would never do it again. Our room was dirty, dark and smelly. The bathroom was tiny, the shower fixture was broken, and there was no hot, or even tepid, water. There was no waste basket in the room, not a single napkin, and no glassware. Promised internet connection, a must in our case, was nonexistent. The staff was not able to move our car, claiming that it was too complicated to start it. We ended up parking it ourselves on the street in the middle of the night. As for being B&B, sufficient to say that self-served breakfast, more like a coffee stand in your local grocery store, offered rotten apples along with bread, bananas and cold cereal. Maybe it was just our luck, but it was a worse hotel stay ever. Shame, really!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: wustceduj
Reviews.Content: I am attracted by the top 5 ranking in san juan hotels. And I would say it is a pretty good hotel: good location and clean room, simple decoration. If you pay below 120, this is something you should consider . Also I want to say the ranking is a little bit overated. Most people here are satisfied with this hotel because their low expectation. I would recommend holiday inn express to you if you increase your budget a little bit(10 bucks per day). You will have a better and modern service there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect more than a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: n2c2e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Canario in December. The rooms however are not the cleanest. The service at least during the nights is quite bad. It appears that the management believes that they are doing you a favor by letting you spend time at their hotel. We had booked for six nights but we ended up moving to the near by Holiday Inn after a couple of nights. The parking situation is quite bad around this area of San Juan. The location however is quite central. This might be a good option if you are looking just for a place to crash while you do the sightseeing in Puertorico.

Reviews.Title: “We Heart the hotel and the Lagoon!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelgals
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Canario in July of last year as a group of 5 girls. It was our post-high school graduation senior trip. We found the hotel on a travel website and took a chance. We were very pleasantly surprised. The property is located in a central area in Condado - very close to restuarants, transportation and the beach. The staff was very helpful and the complimentary breakfast was surprisingly tasty. We booked two rooms opposite eachother. Both were clean, sizeable, and had balconies. One room had a great view overlooking the lagoon (which by the way is a great attraction). There was a slight musty smell in the hallway/elevator, but by day 2 of our four day stay, it just smelled like home. The manager was very understanding and addressed any problems we had. Great place to stay for anyone looking to experience San Juan, especially those on a budget. PS- Ask for Hector - he's great!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: garciafa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 208; 2 twin beds for mom and I. The room was clean and well kept. The air conditioning worked very well. The bathroom was clean and well functioning. Not a 5-star resort bathroom, more like the one we had as kids growing up. The windows in the bathroom would not close completely- I never got to tell management, so they may not even be aware. Check-in was OK, not very enthusiastic or hospitable; but this is a B&B, not an American Resort. I felt it was perfect for the one night. I definitely will consider it again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: fstrdr
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, having been in San Juan once before, we decided to book this hotel for our pre-cruise, one-night stay. Upon arrival, the front/lobby of the hotel is very welcoming. Rafael wasn't there, which I was kinda hoping, but that was OK. We were tired anyway, went up to our room. A very simplistic, 2-star at most room, with concrete/fake marble??? floors, very spartan. We thought, for the money, what can you expect, since other properties were upwards for $250. We did see a newish, from outside, Holiday Inn in the vicinity, which we'll look into next time. Everything else was OK. The mattress was pretty tough and hard, the shower was good, TV had tones of channels. Location wise, it is smack in the middle between the Airport and the cruise terminals, and a short walk to the main strip in San Juan, where all the chichi, expensive stores, like Gucci and the like are located. It's also very close to the beach, which in San Juan is public no matter where you go. Rafael, the next morning, was an excellent guide, directing us in all the right places. We would stay there again, but now we know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lay-Over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmallHotelConnoiseur
Reviews.Content: This charming, European style, 2 star hotel is a delight. It is clean, in a great location (only $16 from the airport), and on a quiet street. It is only 1 block away from the wonderful shops and restaurants near Condado Beach. Our room (#302) had a nice balcony and a window in the bathroom. The management was very friendly and helpful. Our only negative was a rule about not taking one's breakfast out of the breakfast room. This was inconvenient as we frequently have breakfast "on the go". El Canario would be smart to lift this silly restriction. That aside, El Canario by the Lagoon is a real find in an exciting area of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: GaleAS
Reviews.Content: El Canario by the Lagoon This hotel is well situated near the main tourist area of Condado Beach, San Juan. It seems to be a favourite with Cruise Ship passengers for a pre or post cruise stay. We stayed in the hotel after our cruise. The rooms are modest yet comfortable. The showers had lots of hot water. They each have a small balcony and a mini fridge. Breakfast is included and comes with a choice of pastries, bread, assorted cereals, fresh fruit and coffee all served in the main floor breakfast room. An ice machine and daily English Language San Juan newspapers were available. There was parking available for our rental car. Raphael, the front desk clerk was very helpful and was able to answer all of our questions including: Where to rent a car (Charlie Car rental is a few blocks away http://charliecarrentalpr.com/ and had the best rates); where the attractions are and nearby restaurants to dine at. The on-line web booking service worked well for us. www.canariohotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: brianc7
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group, two nights pre cruise, our four couples stayed on the top floor by the terrace, our rooms were basic. but very clean. Had a little trouble with the water pressure in one of our rooms, but it was fixed quickly once the front desk was informed. the proximity to the beach and restaurants were perfect. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable Cove”
Reviews.Author: uniriko
Reviews.Content: Hi all, My wife and I stayed in this hotel prior to a cruise. It was very cozy and surprisingly very quiet at night. The room was spacious and confy. Close to many diferent useful businesses. The beach was just a few minutes away, and restaurants. I would recomend this little nice hotel for a stay. I will be booking again with this hotel for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Affordable, and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: ARoseJ73
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Lagoon for our first trip to San Juan this winter, and absolutely loved it. The rooms are spacious, with a mini fridge, plenty of dresser space, and tile floors. The view from our Balcony was beautiful, and we spent several hours just looking at the city at night.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: AM3
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel before reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor, so was a bit worried. I only needed one night in a hotel in San Juan, I was arriving late at night and leaving early the next morning. The room was very clean. The room was very basic - not well lit, very simple furnishings. I have to believe there is a better value in San Juan, but I couldn't find one in my research before I got there. The breakfast is very minimal, some bread, fruit, and Kellogg's cereals. I was able to park my rental car in their alley.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: We had two nights stay and found it to be very good for the money paid. We were on an around the world trip so the laundry was good for catching up on the washing. Was a bit disappointed in the area for bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: che
Reviews.Content: This is a small, unpretentious place with a small, unpretentious price tag. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms were basic, but the shower, safe and tv all worked well, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. It is well situated and is simply a good choice if you don't want to spend a fortune and don't mind simple accommodations. We would recommend the el Canario, and would stay there again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: kitty006
Reviews.Content: my group have been going to this hotel for the last twelve years the staff are very friendly especialy Raphel and tito we love to shop and they look after our bags as though they were their own we love you and look forwad to november 2007 (lana Barbados)

Reviews.Title: “great value, good room”
Reviews.Author: CATHERINE85
Reviews.Content: great value for the money in san juan, puerto rico. Hotel is close to bus line & used it to go to Old San Juan (buses stop running at around 9pm). The room was clean, a/c & shower in good working condition. The hotel close to Ashford Ave w/lots of resturants & some parks. Only stayed 2 nights but price was right. From the airport- taxi for 2 people w/4 pieces of luggage $17.50-20 (total) & fr Old San Juan to hotel for 2 -$8.00(total).

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bronxite
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, it is modest, but comfortable and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only problem was if you have a lot of luggage as we did (we were going on a cruise) the elevator is small, and we had to make a couple of trips. Other than that, great place, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Modest for a local Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at this hotel for an overnight stay before and after my Southern Caribbean cruise leaving from the Port of San Juan. I booked a group of 20 people altogether and we all thought the hotel was great for a short stay. We were across the street from the beach, and in close walking distance to restaurants, stores, and nightly entertainment. I would stay here again if I needed short stay accomodations but not for an extended stay. There was some minor confusion with the arrangements for my group and I think this was because this hotel isn't used to accomodating groups that often. They could stand for some renovations to be made but all in all the place was clean and comfortable. J. Rochester (Travel Agent from New York)

Reviews.Title: “great staff/beautiful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: edith-rochesterny
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and I stayed for a week, the rooms are very clean, Ruth was very friendly , beautiful hospitality.the front staff were excellent , very friendly, kind but most of all always with a great smile and a warm welcoming, Rafael (I beleave that is your name) keep up the great job and keep smileing. Richard you really need alot of improvement and try to focus more on your guest and their concerns, than your computer, eye contact and a smile goes a long way and the impression will be a lasting one. I will come back to the canario WE LOVED IT. Keep up the good work guys. Rochester, New York

Reviews.Title: “Can't Park Cars without Damaging Them”
Reviews.Author: MobiSys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the week of June 11-15. Needed a place to stay while attending a conference at the Ritz-Carlton after not being able to secure a room at the conference discounted rate at the Ritz (the full rate of $300 per night was too much for someone not sharing a room). At less than $100 per night and only a 4-5 mile drive from the conference, with free off street parking included, I thought this was a good deal. When I got to the hotel it was about what I expected for the price. This was an older property with no carpet in the room and the bathroom was an older style as well (with no counter by the sink) and felt like an undergraduate dormitory, but it was clean and I was not disappointed. So you're probably wondering, why did I rate the overall experience "terrible"? Well if you look at their website, it says "Off-street parking is available free to guests - just leave your keys with the front desk..." Sounds like they have a parking lot that's too small and they want to pack as many cars as they can in there, right? Wrong! There is no lot, there are only two alleys as wide as a single roadway lane, one on each side of the hotel. Cars are parked one behind the other, and they want you to leave your keys at the desk so that if someone parked ahead of you wants to leave, they can move your car out of the way. Okay, no problem, I thought, I can deal with that. I was the last car parked in one of those alleyways when I left my keys by the desk about an hour past midnight. When I went down in the morning and got the key, the car had been reparked across the street. Obviously someone had to leave earlier than I did, and the person at the front desk had found an open street parking space. But, I had scrutinized my car the night before (before driving off the rental lot) and found no damage. There was now a very noticeable scrape on the right rear door, like the car had sideswiped something! It might have been possible that a passing car did this (the street on which the hotel is located is very narrow), but the damage was on the RIGHT side of the car, and the car was parked on the RIGHT side of the street! Curiously, there are these barrel-sized cement cylinders across the street which extend fairly far beyond the curb, and the damage to the car matched the height of one of the cylinders almost exactly! The next time I saw the person who was at the front desk that night, I asked him if he knew anything about the damage to the car. He replied that since he had been off work for a couple days, he "remembered nothing". Uh huh. Didn't want to remember anything is more like it. So they won't admit to damaging the car and I'm stuck with having to deal with the rental agency and my insurance companies. I cannot recommend staying here until the staff learn how to park cars without damaging them, and at the very least telling the truth and accepting responsibility and paying for the damage if they do.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic room”
Reviews.Author: clarinetplayer76
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at El Canario for a pre and post cruise visit to San Juan. The hotel is in a pretty good location...only about a block from the beach and within short walking distance of some nice looking restaurants. The area felt safe, but the neighborhood in general was a little run down. We booked a superior queen room. For our pre-cruise stay, they mistakingly had given us the "suite." It consisted of the basic bedroom and bathroom in addition to an outer room with a patio table, sink, microwave, and full size refrigerator. The outer room was a great place to store luggage, but it was not air conditioned, so its use for us was limited. The four suites on the fifth floor open up to a large rooftop patio...kind of neat, but again, we didn't really use it. Post cruise, we had a superior queen room and it was the same, minus the patio and outer room. It wouldn't be worth the $45 difference in my opinion to get the suite if I were booking again. The room was basic and clean and was adequate for our needs. Some of the rooms have decent views while others would give views of nearby buildings. Each room has a small balcony. The continental breakfast was convenient and good. They were helpful to arrange cabs when needed, and you aren't far from a bus stop if you want to go that route. My biggest complaint was that my credit card had already been billed for both nights. On our post cruise stay they attempted to collect again from us. I had to show them an email from my reservation which stated my credit card would be billed. So I would suggest bringing documentation.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem In San Juan”
Reviews.Author: OutTravels
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Puerto Rico I stayed in this charming hotel for three nights in early May, 2007. It is a small, exceptionally clean, and comfortable place. My room, 308, was very satisfactory. The air conditioner was quiet and kept the room very cold. In fact I often had to turn it down. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom spotlessly clean. A private balcony offered a view of the lagoon. Other reviewers complained of no carpeting in the rooms and hallways but being in a hot and humid tropical locale, tile floors are really preferable. The staff was very helpful in suggesting things to do and even booked a tour of El Yunque National Forest for me. The housekeeping staff do an excellent job at keeping the facility well maintained and sparkling clean. The complimentary breakfasts were very typical of Puerto Rican family breakfast, strong dark coffee, crispy bread and yummy guava pastries. The hotel is on a small quiet street one block from shops and restaurants on Ashford Avenue, and the beach is only 1/2 block further. On my next trip to Puerto RIco, this is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain”
Reviews.Author: InQueens26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you are looking to be close enough to old San Juan without paying the San Juan prices. It is affordable compared to most places and they have parking which is great. (You just have to leave your keys at the front desk) They have a very average free breakfast with fruit and cereal and some danishes. No frills just food. The rooms are VERY plain and not high end at all but good enough if you are just going to sleep there. It even has a nice balcony. There is not too much of a view because you are in the middle of a few hotels but like I said if you plan to only sleep there it is good enough. There in NO POOL, so be aware of that, but the beach is only a two block walk. They do have a nice patio on the roof which you can take pictures and sun bathe of you want. The men in the front desk are usually nice, even if you need your car to get out of the lot they usually are willing to help. The only bad thing are the old women who work there. They all have bad attitudes. One was mopping the the front enterence when i needed to go tot he front desk and as i walked over the area where she mopped she grunted "Ay Dios Mio!" (Oh My God!) Not knowing that I spoke spanish. I dont have wings, I can not fly over a wet surface and I am not waiting for it to dry. Another time was when i went to get fresh towels, the man at the front desk told me you can take dirty towels and they will exchange you for clean ones. Well as I went to the place to ask for clean towels the lady tells me in a nasty tone "Not for the beach!" Just so they know, I can use as many towels as I want during my stay, and if i want to take it to the beach (which I wasn't) that isnt your concern. I am paying for that service. I guess they get pissed that they have to keep washing towels. I got news for you, it's your job! Those nasty comments really pissed off my stay there, but other than that, its just the most affordable chaoice to stay in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: benito12345678
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great for a one night stay before embarking on a cruise. The staff was nice, the rooms were clean, and the location was great. It was in Condado, the hotel district just outside Old San Juan. To get into the Old City, it was a short bus ride that costs $.75 and the bus stop is about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. It had a reasonable price, too. $160 for four people (including taxes) I would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Julianna22
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on other TripAdvisor reviews. We were so pleased. It is a small hotel one block from the beach. It was an easy, picturesque 2 1/2 mile walk to Old San Juan. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were always nicely cleaned and everything worked. The cost for a room with twin beds was $134.62 including taxes, surcharges. That is a great price for teachers on a budget. The staff always arranged our tours. The continental breakfast was very tasty, especially the bread.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the low price”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean_Junky
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days before we boarded a cruise ship. I would say the quality is comparable to a Comfort Inn hotel. It's not very expensive so you can't expect too much. The only problem I found was that because it was so close to a Lagoon, there were a lot of mosquitoes. The view from our balcony was nice though and we were only minutes away from the beach and many restaurants. Do not forget to bring mosquito repellant...we got 12 bites each on the first night because we forgot to bring some. The cost of getting there from the airport by taxi was around $16 US. Overall, I would say this hotel is fine and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Okay For The Money”
Reviews.Author: Laybackone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Canario by the Lagoon on Feburary 24th, for one night before our cruise ($125 plus $15 taxes). It was clean, things worked in the room and the front desk was helpful with our questions. We walked to the beach, to eat and actually almost all the way to Old San Juan. One big plus is the free breakfast in the morning. Eating in San Juan is a rip off, $7 for a (one) drink, $58 for a modest dinner for two. This breakfast would of likely cost $25 if you had gone out for it. FYI it is a $15 taxi ride from the airport and a $13 taxi ride to the (RCCL) dock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Employees”
Reviews.Author: Sun99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Canario by the Lagoon both before and after our cruise for a total of 5 nights. We had two different rooms on the 4th floor. My wife and I had never been to Puerto Rico and were very concern about the place. However, upon arriving we soon felt at home. The staff was excellent and provide us all sorts of information on how to get around, rental car options and all our other needs. They were especially helpfully in providing us a room prior to noon after our cruise ended. We paid $120 per night during this high season. I would recommend this hotel to all. Bill M - Burlington, WA

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustGal
Reviews.Content: This is your typical budget hotel but with a great location. The rooms are big, clean but minimally decorated. Some even have views. I felt the rate I paid was fair - $98 with AAA discount for what I got. The downside is that the staff was not very friendly or helpful. When I asked for suggestions on places to visit, they had none. When my toilet didn't work on the first night they told me that they didn't know how to fix a toilet and since it was a Sunday, maintenance couldn't come till the next day. Only after really pushing did they move me to another room. It was a disappointment since the person I talked to when booking the room was so friendly. The location is great so close to Condado with its restaurants and beach. It's a little hassle to get to Old San Juan if you want to take the bus. They don't exactly run on schedule. The taxis are plentiful though for about $12 each way. All in all I would give this a good recommendation. Good value for what you get in both the room and location. I wouldn't go so far as to say it is a "diamond in the rough" though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BentyUK
Reviews.Content: Was a little shocked to read the previous review criticising this property, but each to their own I suppose. I spent 12 nights here, 13th Jan to 25th Jan and have no complaints. Paid $115 per night booked dirct with the hotel, worket out at Â£135 once taxes etc added. This price includes a complimentary breakfast. Room on the second floor, average view of the surrounding buildings and could just see the lagoon and Old San Juan and the cruise terminal in the distance. Room was large and clean, TV with lots of cable channels, plenty of wardrobe space, adequate balcony and air conditioning. Nice bathroom. Location is excellent, set in the "touristy" Condado area of San Juan, 1 minute walk to nice beach and main strip of bars, shops and resturants. Area is very quite in terms of outside noise. Air conditioner makes noise that air conditioners make. Maid was in every day with fresh towels. staff very helpful and friendly, speaking excellent English. $10 in taci to Old San Juan if you like or 75 cents on bus (have correct change). Excellent stay would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Must have stayed on the worst weekend they ever served up. Never will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Blye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the El Canario by-the Lagoon for one night post cruise January 21 2007. We booked the place because we were unable to stay again at the Milano in Old San Juan we we had stayed for two nights pre cruise, (A Hotel which I'd recommend the hotel as it's close to everything including the cruise ship docks (short walk)) and largely because of the favorable reviews here on Trip Advisor. Until now we have found them to be bang on and I guess we were due for a let-down. The Canario was possibly the single worst room we've ever had, the list of deficiencies is long. I'll pick a sample and list a few. Our air conditioner made as much noise as an electric lawn mower, we were given a dirty dark room on the forth floor perched neatly over the sound of car alarms going off ALL night right in front of the hotel . I swear we may have only go 2 hours sleep, the barking dogs at least had the decency to call it off at 1am! There were hairs in the shower stall, on the floor and grossest of all, between the sheets when we turned the bed down! (yuk!!!) The TV was not set up to receive the satellite channels and I ended up programming it for myself. Just a few examples which shows the complete lack of interest-to-details the staff gave our room. But here's the kicker... the light in our bathroom didn't work. When I pointed this out at 2pm, I was told that there was nothing that could be done about it, and was asked why I hadn't mentioned it the day before? We had just checked in!!! The desk clerk then after being asked what I should do, after all a light in the bathroom was pretty basic, (I am not making this up!!!) handed me a flash light!!!! I am not kidding. A Flash light!!!! Even if it was $ 30.00 a night I would not ever stay there again, at $ 135.00 it was a pure insult to hoteliers everywhere. I am glad others have had favorable experiences here, we did not. Like I said, we were due I guess, we stay at "boutique hotels all over the world and know what to expect. A nights sleep (which we didn't get at the Canario, is the most basic expectation.

HotelInfo.Name: El Canario by the Lagoon
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Clemenceau Street | Condado, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
